multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way eels breathe?

options.label: A
options.text: They have large gills to extract oxygen from the water.

options.label: B
options.text: They can only breathe through their mouth.

options.label: C
options.text: They have the ability to breathe through their skin.

options.label: D
options.text: They can only breathe in saltwater environments.

multiple-choice.question: In which direction do eels of the genus Anguilla migrate?

options.label: A
options.text: From freshwater to saltwater to spawn, and then back to freshwater.

options.label: B
options.text: From saltwater to freshwater to spawn, and then back to saltwater.

options.label: C
options.text: From freshwater to saltwater to spawn, and then they stay in saltwater.

options.label: D
options.text: From saltwater to freshwater to live, and then back to saltwater to spawn.

multiple-choice.question: Where are eels of the genus Anguilla born?

options.label: B
options.text: In the Sargasso Sea, a part of the North Atlantic Ocean.

options.label: C
options.text: In the Gulf Stream, off the coast of North America.

options.label: D
options.text: In the estuaries and brackish water of Europe.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name given to the stage of an eel's life cycle when it is about two inches long and still transparent?
How is the gender of an eel determined?

options.label: B
options.text: It is determined by the eel's size.

options.label: C
options.text: It is determined once an eel enters freshwater, although the exact mechanism is unknown.

options.label: D
options.text: It is determined by the eel's species.

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the migration of eels from freshwater to the ocean?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the smallest migration of any fish species.

options.label: B
options.text: It is one of the largest unseen migrations on the planet.

options.label: C
options.text: It only occurs during the day.

options.label: D
options.text: It only occurs during the summer months.

multiple-choice.question: What changes occur in an eel's body as it prepares to migrate from freshwater to the ocean?

options.label: A
options.text: Its eyes get smaller, its skin gets thinner, and its fins get smaller.

options.label: B
options.text: Its eyes get larger, its skin gets thicker, and its fins get larger.

options.label: C
options.text: Its eyes stay the same, its skin gets thinner, and its fins get smaller.

options.label: D
options.text: Its eyes get smaller, its skin gets thicker, and its fins get larger.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name given to the process by which eels gather in large masses and release their eggs and sperm?
Why do scientists assume that adult eels die after completing their migration and spawning?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they have been observed dying in large numbers.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they have never been seen returning up freshwater rivers.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are known to have a short lifespan.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are vulnerable to predators in the ocean.

multiple-choice.question: How long can a female eel grow in freshwater environments?

title: The history of our world in 18 minutes - David Christian

options.label: C

title: Why is glass transparent? - Mark Miodownik

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The energy levels are too far apart

options.label: C
options.text: Infrared light, because it has too little energy

options.label: D
